meanings.definition: To prepare meat by removing bones and excess fat
meanings.sent1: She was frenching the chicken before cooking it.
meanings.sent2: The chef was frenching the ribs for the barbecue.
meanings.sent3: The butcher joked that he was a pro at frenching meat.
meanings.sent4: Her knife skillfully frenching the steak, leaving it lean and ready to grill.
meanings.sent5: The method of frenching meat made the dish look more elegant and appetizing.

meanings.definition: To cut food into thin strips
meanings.sent1: He was frenching the carrots for the salad.
meanings.sent2: The chef was frenching the potatoes for the fries.
meanings.sent3: She accidentally started frenching the bread instead of slicing it.
meanings.sent4: The sharp knife made frenching the vegetables quick and easy.
meanings.sent5: The technique of frenching the vegetables added a gourmet touch to the dish.

meanings.definition: The act of kissing with tongues involved
meanings.sent1: Their frenching in the park caught everyone's attention.
meanings.sent2: The movie scene showed a romantic frenching moment.
meanings.sent3: The teenagers giggled at the idea of frenching in public.
meanings.sent4: In the play, the actors performed a passionate frenching scene.
meanings.sent5: The novel described their intense frenching as a symbol of their love.
